item.title: Fast Algorithms for $\pi$ and Elliptic Integrals
item.description: On this installment of Chill Math Friends, we learned a bit about a fast algorithm for $\pi$ and elliptic integrals. Gauss-Legendre Algorithm Let’s start by diving into the Gauss-Legendre algorithm. The algorithm is: Start with $a_0=1, b_0=\frac 1 {\sqrt 2}$ Repeat the following until desired accuracy \begin{align*} a*{n+1} & = \frac{a_n + b_n} 2 \\ b*{n+1} & = \sqrt{an b_n} \\ t{n+1} & = 1 - 2 \cdot \sum_{j=1}^n 2^j (a_j^2 - b_j^2)^2 \end{align*} We then have an approximation $p_n$ of $\pi$ with $$p_n = \frac{(a_n + b_n)^2}{t_n}$$ This approximation is quadratic, in the sense that $|\pi - p_{n+1}| < 0.
